page.title: 16WELCOME HOME FUND: SHAWHEAD
page.content: Mr Learmont is one of the oldest people in the village and one of his memories is of the soldiers coming home from World War II. A public meeting was held on Wednesday 1st November 1944 to elect a 'Welcome Home Fund' committee. Reverend William Rock was Chairman and 15 other people were elected. The target was to raise Â£750, an enormous amount in those days. There was a house to house which raised Â£153-8s-6d, a whist drive on December 15th which raised Â£40-1s-6d and other things including a free gift sale that raised Â£440. At the sale they sold Duck eggs, potatoes, lambs, calves, haggis, a knitted penguin, a bed jacket and a string bag. The fund total was Â£790-2s-3d. Everyone in the forces for more than a year got Â£20 and for less than a year they got Â£5.
